author: Special Correspondent
text:
A day after the Pudukottai police received a complaint from a Dalit youth M. Vinoth (27) claiming that his lover Priyanka belonging to another caste was being threatened by her parents opposed their marriage, the girl was sent to a short stay home at Tiruchi.

In his petition to Superintendent of Police, Vinoth had expressed apprehension that the girl’s parents would resort to honour killing of Priyanka and pleaded for immediate intervention besides seeking protection for his personal safety.

Acting on the complaint, an officer from the Vadakadu police station was sent to the girl’s house on Monday to ascertain the facts. The sources said the girl was not illegally confined in the house although her parents were opposed to their daughter’s love affair with Vinoth. The police said the girl’s parents wanted to get her married off to another person against her wishes.

The girl reportedly left home and was spotted near the bus stand by her uncle who took her to the police station, the sources said. The girl reportedly requested the police to make alternative arrangements for her stay.

The police contacted the Social Welfare Department officials and the girl was sent to a short stay home in Tiruchi on Tuesday.
title: Pudukottai girl admitted to short stay home
